{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mossy fibers are axons of granule cells in the dentate gyrus of the hippocampus. They are known to release glutamate, which is an excitatory neurotransmitter. GABA, on the other hand, is an inhibitory neurotransmitter. Based on this information, it is unlikely that mossy fibers release GABA. Therefore, the answer is B. no.", "answer_choice": "B"}
